meanings.definition: Having the luster of a pearl.
meanings.sent1: The pearl necklace looked pearlier than the shiny marble.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was pearlier than the clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur was so pearlier that it almost looked like it had been dipped in glitter.
meanings.sent4: The dew on the morning grass sparkled pearlier than any gem.
meanings.sent5: The princess wore a gown that shimmered pearlier than the moonlight.

meanings.sent1: The new car was pearlier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: Her smile was pearlier than a row of pearls.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated so pearlier that it seemed almost too beautiful to eat.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky shone pearlier than ever before.
meanings.sent5: The snow on the mountaintop glistened pearlier than a winter wonderland.

meanings.definition: Resembling a pearl in color or luster.
meanings.sent1: The seashell had a pearlier sheen than any other on the beach.
meanings.sent2: Her eyes were pearlier than the ocean on a sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The car's paint job was so pearlier that it caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The full moon glowed pearlier than a perfect sphere of pearl.
meanings.sent5: The morning mist made the landscape appear pearlier than a dream.
